sub_title: Director of JAAP Enterprise for Art Scientific Studies
summary:
My research has a strong focus on molecular material science of paintings. This work is presently performed in the studio and laboratory of JAAP Enterprise for Art Scientific Studies. We are open for research work requested by museums and private individuals. In recent years we have been working for example on Jordaens, Vermeer, Van der Goes, Rothko, Amiet, and Munch. We assist in authenticity studies of paintings.  As part time stafmember of SIK-ISEA in Zurich (till 2015) I collaborated with Dr Ester Fereira (head of analytical art research) to perform material scientific work of art using various synchrotron Xray methods to study paint cross sections and thin sections. Neutron radiography of the stratigraphy of paintings has been developed to study water transport in primed canvas..

Various stand systems with XY translation suitable for digital modular microscopes like the Hirox have been designed and are sold to museums in Europe, Australia and USA. Portable ones as well as larger systems such a movable table with a bridge or cube for horizontal and vertical examination.  The stands are also suitable for XRF work, IRR examination, macrophotography and spectroscopic studies of works of art. Hyperspectral imaging via the microscope has been tested and is developed into a commercially viable system.

Jaap Enterprise sells the MOPAS hand polishing device for high polish without surface residues suitable for high resolution analytical spectroscopy. A prime example is the improved attachment of antibodies on paint cross section after MOPAS polishing. These devices are now in use by museum conservation staff or private restorers in the a number of European countries, USA and Australia. We offer ion polishing services for cross sections of metals, paper, and paint.

Jaap Enterprise carries out high resolution digital microscopy of art work for museums, galeries and restoration studios. We perform p-XRF work as well. Just contact us.
